identificationModule.briefTitle: Use of New Generation Fetoscopes in Pregnancies Affected by Fetal Diseases Amenable to Fetoscopy Therapy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Use of New Generation Fetoscopes in Pregnancies Affected by Fetal Diseases Amenable to Fetoscopy Therapy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The Researchers are trying to determine feasibility and safety of performing surgery in the womb with the Karl Storz fetoscopes (a tool used to access the baby in the body of the mother). This are new and improved fetoscopes that are not yet approved by the FDA.

conditions: In Utero Procedure Affecting Fetus or Newborn

armGroups.label: Karl Storz fetoscopes
armGroups.description: Participants will receive In utero surgery using the new generation Karl Storz fetoscopes (11508AAK and 11506AAK) for fetal conditions amenable to treatment with fetoscopy.
interventionNames: Device: Karl Storz New Generation Fetoscope - curved 11508AAK
Device: Karl Storz New Generation Fetoscope - straight 11506AAK

interventions.name: Karl Storz New Generation Fetoscope - curved 11508AAK
interventions.description: 11508AAK Miniature straight forward telescope 0-degree set, curved, diameter 3.3 millimeter, length 30 centimeter, 30,000 pixels, autoclavable, irrigation connector, central working channel 4 french, lateral working channel 3 French., remote eyepiece, fiber optic light transmission incorporated.

interventions.name: Karl Storz New Generation Fetoscope - straight 11506AAK
interventions.description: 11506AAK Miniature straight forward telescope 0-degree, straight, diameter 3.3 millimeter, length 30 cm, 30,000 pixels, autoclavable, irrigation connector, central working channel 4 french, lateral working channel 3 french, remote eyepiece, fiber optic light transmission incorporated.

primaryOutcomes.description: The count of subjects who experience adverse events
The count of subjects who experience serious adverse events
The number of device malfunction incidents

secondaryOutcomes.description: The mean gestational age at delivery. Measured in weeks.

The number of successful fetoscopic surgeries in twin twin transfusion syndrome. The measure of success is being able to ablate all anastomoses thought to be involved in causing the twin twin transfusion syndrome.

Surgeon reported satisfaction of the use of the Karl Storz fetoscopes as measured by a 3 item Likert scale questionnaire. The 3 items are scored from 0 - 3, 0 being strongly disagree to 3 being strongly agree. Total scores range from 0 - 9, lower scores indicate less satisfaction, and higher scores indicate more satisfaction.
The number of subjects to have a live birth following in-utero surgery
The number of subjects who experience a neonate death following in-utero surgery

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient is a pregnant woman 18 and older
* The mother must be healthy enough to have surgery
* The mother must be scheduled for surgery
* Patient provides signed informed consent that details the maternal and fetal risks involved with the procedure

Exclusion Criteria:

* Age \<18 years
* Contraindication to abdominal surgery, fetoscopic surgery, or general anesthesia
* Preterm labor, preeclampsia, or uterine anomaly (e.g., large fibroid tumor) in the index pregnancy.
* Fetal aneuploidy, any significant pathogenic or likely significant pathogenic findings on Karyotype or Microarray (if available, but not required), other major fetal anomalies that impacts significantly the fetal/neonatal survival.
